question: And what if I don't want to give up on her?
answer: You don't call.

question: But you said I shouldn't call if I wanted to give up on her.
answer: Right.

question: So I don't call either way.
answer: Right.

question: So what's the difference?
answer: The only difference between giving up and not giving up is if you take her back when she wants to come back. See, you can't do anything to make her want to come back. You can only do things to make her not want to come back.

question: So the only difference is if I forget about her or pretend to forget about her.
answer: Right.

question: Well that sucks.
answer: It sucks.

question: So it's almost a retroactive decision. So I could, like, let's say, forget about her and when she comes back make like I just pretended to forget about her.
answer: Right...or more likely the opposite.

question: Right... Wait, what do you mean?
answer: I mean first you'll pretend not to care, not call - whatever, and then, eventually, you really won't care.

question: Unless she comes back first.
answer: Ah, see, that's the thing. Somehow they don't come back until you really don't care anymore.

question: There's the rub.
answer: There's the rub.

question: ...It's just that you've been there. Your advice really helps.

answer: You're money.

question: Yeah. I guess you could call it that.
answer: Definitely. Two days. That's the industry standard...

question: ... I used to wait two days. Now everyone waits two days. Three days is kinda money now, don't you think?
answer: ... Yeah. But two's enough not to look anxious...

question: ... Whatever. You're like a whining little woman. Big deal. You got a fuckin' number. Whoopee! You'll fuck it up...
Have you gotten laid once since you moved here? Did you fuck once?
answer: ... Shut up, Sue...

question: I know for a fact you haven't, because you never shut up about it. Your like a little whiney bitch...
answer: Sue!

question: Shut up.
answer: Hi. This is Nikki. Leave a message.

question: Hi, Nikki. This is Mike. I met you tonight at the Dresden. I, uh, just called to say I, uh, I'm really glad we met and you should give me a call. So call me tomorrow, or , like, in two days, whatever. My number is 213-555-4679...
answer: Hi. This is Nikki. Leave a message.

question: Hi, Nikki. This is Mike, again. I just called because it sounded like your machine might've cut me off before I gave you my number, and also to say sorry for calling so late, but you were still there when I left the Dresden, so I knew I'd get your machine. Anyway, my number is...
answer: Hi. This is Nikki. Leave a message.

question: 213-555-4679. That's all. I just wanted to leave my number. I don't want you to think I'm weird, or desperate or something... ... I mean, you know, we should just hang out. That's it. No expectations. Just, you know, hang out. Bye.
answer: Hi. This is Nikki. Leaves a message.

question: I just got out of a six-year relationship. Okay? That should help to explain why I'm acting so weird. It's not you. It's me. I just wanted to say that. Sorry. This is Mike.
answer: Hi. This is Nikki. Leave a message.

question: Hi, Nikki. This is Mike again. Could you just call me when you get in? I'll be up for awhile, and I'd just rather talk to you in person instead of trying to squeeze it all...
answer: Hi. This is Nikki. Leave a message.

question: Hi, Nikki. Mike. I don't think this is working out. I think you're great, but maybe we should just take some time off from each other. It's not you, really. It's me. It's only been six months...
answer: Mike?

question: Nikki! Great! Did you just walk in, or were you listening all along?
answer: Don't call me ever again.

question: Thanks, man.
answer: No problem, buddy. You eat anything today? Yesterday? You haven't been drinking, have you?

question: No. Just O.J. Sorry about what happened at the Dresden. I had no idea...
answer: Don't sweat it. Now I got an L.A. gun story. You should hear the way I tell to the guys back home. He had an Uzi. You want to talk about it?

question: What's the point?
answer: It's been two days. You should call that girl Nikki...

question: Uuuuugh!
answer: Oh boy.

question: I'm such an asshole.
answer: She wasn't your type anyway.

question: I think I'm gonna move Back East.
answer: Well, that's dumb.

question: What's dumb about it?
answer: Well, you're doing so well...

question: How am I doing well? I host an open mike and I played a fuckin' bus driver in a movie. Big fuckin' deal. I'm with an agency that specializes in fuckin magicians. How good am I doing?
answer: At least you didn't get turned down for Goofy...

question: They turned you down?
answer: They went for someone with more theme park experience. I woulda killed for that job. See, it's all how you look at it. If your life sucks, then mine is God awful. I mean, I moved out here partially because I saw how well you were doing. You got in the union, you got an agent. I thought if you could make it, maybe I could too...

question: I didn't make it...
answer: That's your problem, man. You can't see what you've got, only what you've lost. Those guys are right. You are "money".

question: Then why won't she call...?
answer: Because you left, man. She's got her own world to deal with in New York. She was a sweet girl but fuck her. You gotta move on. You gotta let go of the past. The future is so beautiful. Every day is so sunny out here. It's like Manifest Destiny man. I mean, we made it. What's past is prologue. That which does not kill us makes us stronger. All that shit. You'll get over it.

question: How did you get over it? I mean how long 'til it stopped hurting?
answer: Sometimes is still hurts. You know how it is, man. I mean, each day you think about it less and less. And then one day you wake up and you don't think of it at all, and you almost miss that feeling. It's kinda weird. You miss the pain because it was part of your life for so long. And the, boom, something reminds you of her, and you just smile that bittersweet smile.

question: You miss the pain?
answer: ... for the same reason you miss her. You lived with it so long.

question: Wow. You wanna grab a bite?
answer: Sure. By the way, the guys back home said she put on some weight.

question: Bitch! You little bitch! Trent. Take over. I'm so sorry, man. You were so right. I got rid of the gun
answer: What are they doing here?

question: We ran into them that night at Roscoe's. Tee cleared it up, I apologized, bought them some chicken and waffles. They fuckin love Tee. That boy can talk. But most important, man, I'm sorry about what I said. I was drunk... My adrenaline was going...
answer: Don't sweat it, man. I needed a kick in the ass. We're better friends for it.

question: Thanks, man. I've been hating myself for the last two days.
answer: Believe me, I know what that's like. Yo, Double Down! What time are we leaving?

question: Hi.
answer: Hi.

question: I'm Mike.
answer: Hi, Mike. I'm Lorraine.

question: Like the quiche?
answer: Yes. Like the quiche.

question: I like quiche.
answer: I thought real men don't like quiche.

question: My reputation seems to have preceded me.
answer: Why? You're not a real man?

question: ... so I thought, what the hell, they make movies in L.A., not in Michigan, so I moved here.
answer: Just like that?

question: Well, it wasn't the simple, but yeah.
answer: How was it hard?

question: Well, I left someone very special behind.
answer: Tell me about it...

question: You too?
answer: Yeah.

question: I thought I was going to die.
answer: It's been six months and I'm just starting to get over it.

question: Oh, God. That's two more than me. Tell me it gets better.
answer: It does.

question: How?
answer: Well, it still sucks, but you start to see that there are advantages to being single.

question: Like what?
answer: What what? What advantages?

question: What else?
answer: What else...? Let's see... You have complete freedom.

question: To do what?
answer: I don't know.... To grow, to go out. Whatever you want.

question: Anything?
answer: Anything.

question: Like if I meet a handsome young man and I wanted to ask him to dance? I can do that?
answer: Uh, if the guy wants to.

question: You don't think the guy would find me attractive enough to dance with?
answer: Yes. I mean, no. I mean, maybe he would find her, I mean you attractive. Maybe he doesn't like to dance. Maybe all he likes to do is just stand around and drink and smoke and look cool with his buddies who don't dance either...

question: Maybe it doesn't matter if he's a good dancer cause it's a slow song, if that's what he's afraid of.
answer: No... Maybe that's not the case. Maybe she shouldn't be such a smug little shit because she'd be surprised at what a good dancer he really is, but it's been a long time and he doesn't know if he's ready to...

question: Mike... ... Will you dance with me?
answer: Sure I will.

question: Well... This is it.
answer: Listen. I had a great time.

question: Me too.
answer: I would love to see you again sometime.

question: I'll be around.
answer: That's not good enough. I want to make plans to see you.

question: Let me get a pen out of my car. Do you have something to write on? You're a comedian?
answer: Yeah. And an actor.

question: I'll have to come see you sometime.
answer: If and when I get a real gig I'll call you.

question: It's not going to well?
answer: When I lived in New York they made it sound like they were giving out sit-coms to stand-ups at the airport. I got off the plane in L.A. six months ago and all I got to show for it is a tan.

question: Didn't you tell me to be patient with my career?
answer: ... Yeah, but entertainment law isn't something you just jump into...

question: Neither is acting. Not if you're serious about it. Can I have one of these?
answer: Why, you like the duck with the cigar?

question: Yeah. Nice touch. It's the logo from "You Bet Your Life", right?
answer: Good eye. Not one club owner got it. They all ask me why I got Donald Duck on my card.

question: Hey, at least it's not Goofy. Well, I should be getting...
answer: ... It's really getting late.

question: ... home. It's getting late. Yeah. Can I give you a ride to your car...?
answer: ... Nah. I'm right across the street...

question: ... Which one...?
answer: ... The red piece of shit over there...

question: ... well, it suits you...
answer: ... get the hell outta here already...

question: The bear's got his claws back.
answer: Be smart about it.

question: I'm telling you. Wait three days...
answer: You don't have to wait three days...

question: ... Okay, two...
answer: ... just be smart about it.

question: Hello? Michelle?
answer: How's it going? It's been a while...

question: ... Six months.
answer: How are you doing?

question: Fine... I guess. You?
answer: Good. I think about things.

question: Yeah?
answer: Yeah.

question: What kind of things?
answer: You know, us.

question: I thought you met someone else.
answer: It doesn't matter. I think about you every day.

question: Really?
answer: I miss you, Mike.

question: Why didn't you call?
answer: I couldn't. Do you know how hard it's been not to call you? I pick up the phone every night. Whenever that commercial comes on...

question: ... the Micheline commercial...
answer: ... Yeah, with the baby in the tire. One time I started to cry right in front of Pierre...

question: Pierre... That's his name? Pierre? Is he French?
answer: No, he's not... Listen I don't want to talk about him. That's a whole other headache. I called because I heard you might be moving back to Queens...

question: Hang on. Let me get rid of this call. Hello?
answer: Hi, Mike?

question: Lorraine?
answer: Are you on the other line?

question: Yeah, hold on.
answer: I can call back...

question: No, no. Hold on. Hi.
answer: I heard you might be moving back...

question: Yeah, uh, I don't think that's gonna be happening any time soon... Listen, can I call you right back? I gotta take this call...
answer: I'm not home and going out of town tomorrow for a week. Can't you talk for five more minutes?

question: I really want to catch up with you, but I've gotta take this call. They're holding. I'll talk with you when you get back in town. Bye.
answer: Goodbye. I lov.....
